title: The Whirlpool of Thrive Model
description: The Whirlpool of Thrive is a holistic model of wellbeing that recognizes the interconnected layers of our existence, from our spiritual core to our environmental context.

layers.name: Wairua / Spirit
layers.description: The core of your whirlpool - your spiritual essence, connection to purpose, meaning, and values.
prompts: What gives your life meaning and purpose?
What values are most important to you?
How do you connect with something larger than yourself?

layers.name: Mauri / Energy
layers.description: Your life force and vitality - the energy that animates and sustains you through each day.
prompts: How is your overall energy level?
What activities energize you?
What drains your energy?

layers.name: Mind
layers.description: Your thoughts, emotions, beliefs, and mental patterns that shape your experience.
prompts: What thought patterns do you notice?
How do you relate to difficult emotions?
What beliefs shape your view of yourself and the world?

layers.name: Nervous System
layers.description: Your body's stress response and regulation system that influences how you respond to life.
prompts: How does your body respond to stress?
What helps you feel calm and centered?
How do you recover after challenging experiences?

layers.name: Body
layers.description: Your physical health, movement, rest, and sensory experience of the world.
prompts: How do you care for your physical health?
What is your relationship with movement and rest?
How do you experience the world through your senses?

layers.name: Relationships
layers.description: Your connections with others - family, friends, partners, and colleagues.
prompts: What are your most important relationships?
How do you give and receive support?
What patterns do you notice in your relationships?

layers.name: Community
layers.description: Your belonging to groups, communities, and collective identities.
prompts: What communities are you part of?
How do you contribute to your communities?
Where do you feel a sense of belonging?

layers.name: Environment
layers.description: Your physical surroundings, access to nature, and the broader ecology you're part of.
prompts: How does your environment affect your wellbeing?
What is your connection to the natural world?
How do you shape and respond to your surroundings?
